intro: Daucophyllum, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant is native to coastal regions of Europe and is often found in sandy or saline soils. Daucophyllum typically grows in maritime environments, thriving in areas with salt spray and strong winds. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for coastal ecosystems.
